thread.title: Claudio Ranieri says Leicester are paying the price for last season's success after picking up Laureus award
thread.title_full: Claudio Ranieri says Leicester are paying the price for last season's success after picking up Laureus award

author: Press Association
title: Claudio Ranieri says Leicester are paying the price for last season's success after picking up Laureus award
text:
Sport Claudio Ranieri says Leicester are paying the price for last season's success after picking up Laureus award The Foxes won the Laureus Spirit of Sport award in Monaco for their remarkable Premier League triumph last season Share Ranieri picked up Leicester's latest award in Monaco (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Leicester manager Claudio Ranieri picked up another award to mark his team's stunning Premier League title campaign and admitted the achievement may have taken its toll. 
The Italian was presented with the Laureus Spirit of Sport award in Monaco by compatriot and former England boss Fabio Capello. 
Leicester are battling to beat the drop this season, in a drastic change of fortunes after last term's remarkable trophy-winning feat. 
Ranieri said after receiving the award on behalf of the club: "It's unbelievable what we achieved last season and maybe we are paying something this year. The Foxes are in freefall (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
"We are in the battle to be relegated. 
"But it's okay. It was an amazing year. 
"We were together, we involved all the people in Leicester and I think also around the world because we felt adopted by all the world, and I want to say thank you again to my lads because what we did last year was terrific." poll loading Will Claudio Ranieri last the season as Leicester manager? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
